content: let's take a short break from all the sci-fi stuff and go back to our bread
and butter clip-on features these are compatible
with your dungeon tiles from the first five episodes of the channel or your
true tiles 3d printed tiles that you may have purchased
from chipboard or matte board or other
very heavy cardstock that's about a sixteenth of an inch thick cut to each
of these pieces and from double corrugated cardboard cut one of this
piece glue all five together as shown and then apply corrugation cladding very
similar to what we did back in episode 14 I recommend using glue stick for this
so that you don't introduce extra thickness and also so that you have time
to line up the pieces perfectly using your hot glue gun tease the glue and a
kind of swirling effect base in solid white mix some paralyzing medium with a
light blue solid coat of this on the swirling ether itself and then while
it's still wet streak in some solid white for the frame I painted it with
shimmering silver which is a metallic that is much more vibrant than gunmetal
this is a bracelet just some costume
jewelry I'm going to cut a short segment from it and then super glue it to the
top of the frame again as always I recommend Loctite gel control super glue
and then a couple more gemstones along the frame and a high gloss varnish for
the ether itself so here it is in context remember like all the other
clip-on features we've done on this channel this one's made to grasp a
quarter inch thick wall because a double corrugated piece in the middle is a
quarter inch thick and that's how thick our walls are so if you're new to the
channel I recommend watching the first five episodes to understand how these
clip ons are intended to work and here's the angelic portal next to the evil
portal from way back in episode 14 for context
I am why lock thank you for joining me and I'll see you next time
you
